definition: lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
as/as if/such as
maltose syrup

sentences.english: How did ya' know I'd give my heart gladly?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎麼知道我甘之如飴地將我的心獻給你的？

sentences.english: It seems austere but he enjoys it very much, never feeling insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 看似清苦，可是他甘之如飴，從不覺得還缺少什麼。

sentences.english: Nancy, if you were my wife I'd drink it.
sentences.chinese: 南茜，你要是我夫人，就是毒咖啡我也甘之如飴。

definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to spare no effort
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
omniscient
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
docile and obedient/all obedience
to keep silent
to bear grudges
to remain unmoved
separated in life and death/to part for ever
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
